cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of identifying defective items in a population using group testing, which is a well-studied problem in computer science. The paper proposes an improved encoding and decoding scheme for non-adaptive threshold group testing, which involves identifying up to d defective items among a population of n items using a minimum number of tests. This problem is closely related to information theory (cs.IT), as it involves encoding and decoding information about the defective items. The paper also involves algorithmic and computational aspects of the problem, which are related to data structures (cs.DS), distributed computing (cs.DC), and computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper proposes a practical scheme for group testing, which involves statistical inference and machine learning techniques, which are related to social and information networks (cs.SI).
